chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Clay E. Thomas Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 318 days, if revoked.
Deft accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to court every Wed at 3:30pm.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Deft accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to court every Wed at 3:30pm.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: **ANY UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL TO BE COLLECTED.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 3

Defendant Clay E Thomas appeared with Attorney Carl Johnson.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Fowler.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 3-Fel BJ, Repeater; found guilty by the court.  Cts 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8 were all dismissed and read-in.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.
Ct 3:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  318 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Appeal rights given.  Def. accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to court every Wed. at 3:30pm.
Plea and Sentencing hrg set for 5/25/16 at 3:30pm before Br 4 Drug Court.  The 5/16/16 STC hrg w/Br 6 is canceled.
